item.title: From Concept to Production with Observability in LLM Applications
item.author: Hadi Javeed
item.description:
From Concept to Production with Observability in LLM Applications

Understanding observability in AI applications, particularly in Large Language Models (LLMs), is crucial. It's all about tracking how your model performs over time, which is especially challenging with text generation outputs. Unlike categorical outputs, text generation can vary widely, making it essential to monitor the behavior and performance of your model closely.

item.title: Is Your Security Posture Holding Your Healthcare Startup Back?
item.author: Hadi Javeed
item.description:
Is Your Security Posture Holding Your Healthcare Startup Back?

When deploying a healthcare product, HIPAA compliance is crucial. No matter how innovative your solution is, without convincing the CIO or security team, you won't get deployed. I view security and HIPAA posture as essential features of any healthcare product.

item.title: AI Gave Engineers 20 Hours Back Per Week. Why Aren't We Shipping Faster?
item.author: Hadi Javeed
item.description:
AI Gave Engineers 20 Hours Back Per Week. Why Aren't We Shipping Faster?

AI has compressed time in my life. This time compression has unlocked a lot, but perhaps not in the ways you'd expect.

Nothing you don't already know, right?

item.title: Does Your Startup Really Need Complex Cloud Infrastructure?
item.author: Hadi Javeed
item.description:
Does Your Startup Really Need Complex Cloud Infrastructure?

I recently listened to Pieter Levels{:target="_blank"} on the Lex Friedman Podcast{:target="_blank"}, and it was eye-opening. Pieter has built numerous successful micro-SaaS businesses by running his applications on single server, avoiding cloud infrastructure complexity, and focusing on what truly matters: product-market fit.

item.title: Cognitive Architecture Patterns in Health Care for LLMs
item.author: Hadi Javeed
item.description:
Cognitive Architecture Patterns in Health Care for LLMs

We're inspired by the ideas from this Cognitive Architecture paper{target=_blank} and an insightful Langchain Blog{target=_blank} by Harrison Chase.

At RevelAI Health{target=_blank}, we're exploring how to create closed-loop, safe agents in healthcare — systems that can reason and execute on patient needs in a secure and reliable way. The key is understanding how these agentic systems should think, the flow of execution in response to patient intent, and ensuring safety through structured, observable loops.

item.title: Delayed task queue: How Vincere evolved from one Lambda to a persistent queue
item.author: Hadi Javeed
item.description:
Delayed task queue: How Vincere evolved from one Lambda to a persistent queue

Vincere uses incentives. behavioral nudges and evidence-based interventions for healthy behaviors and making healthy choices. This requires us to track multiple events for users and nudging them through reminders/notifications towards better health

item.title: Helping People Quit Smoking Through Financial Rewards
item.author: Hadi Javeed
item.description:
Helping People Quit Smoking Through Financial Rewards

Guest post on AWS Startups Blog{:target="_blank"}

Smoking is still the leading cause of preventable death, and the pandemic made matters worse: cigarette sales increased in 2020 for the first time in over 20 years. There are over 34 million adult smokers in the US, many of whom are lower income. Reaching them and providing effective support at this scale while keeping costs down can only be achieved with the aid of technology and carefully designed patient experience.
